comment._content:
Built for millionaire New York clothier Isaac Brokaw. Brokaw's eldest son, George, who inherited the mansion, was briefly married to Clare Boothe, but she divorced him. Clare Boothe Brokaw later wed Henry Luce, the founder of Time and Life magazines. (Clare Boothe Luce was a playwright ["The Women"], a congresswoman, and served as U. S. Ambassador to Italy.)

Another Bain/LOC view of the Brokaw mansion:

comment.author: 36899742@N00
comment._content: I think this image shows Isaac's mansion, which was at 1 East 79th Street (you can see that the front entrance is on the cross street, which must be 79th). What you can't see in the photo on the left, directly across 5th Ave from the mansion, is Central Park. The mansion became the offices of the IEEE in the 1940s, and they have published a nice history of the building, along with photos of the exterior and interior, on their website at www.ieeeghn.org/wiki/index.php/Brokaw_Mansion:_IRE_Headqu....
